htmlDecode

public static java.lang.String htmlDecode(java.lang.String aString)
This method html-decodes the given string and returns this decoded one. The characters that are decoded are
  • '<'
  • '>'
  • '"'
  • '&'

Parameters:
aString - the string to be html decoded
Returns:
the resultant decoded string

htmlEncode

public static java.lang.String htmlEncode(java.lang.String aString)
This method html-encodes the given string and returns the encoded one. The characters that are encoded are
  • '>'
  • '<'
  • '"'
  • '&'
At the same time, it does not encode &# entities assuming these to be representations of unicode characters.

Parameters:
aString - the string to be html encoded
Returns:
the resultant encoded string
